content: few row as you go and work until you have yardage 4 times the width of the blanket remaining in mc work the last row and use the last of your yarn for the last couple pieces of fringe pull yarn through final loop add fringe block lightly cloud iridescence by kathryn bernard for firebird yarns firebirdyarns com fringe you need scissors your crochet hook your fluffy mc for every row of crochet cut two 12 pieces of mc for the sample that was about 264 pieces or 44 yards 1 for each mc-cc pair of tails use two pieces of fringe yarn folded in half 2 insert hook behind mc-cc pair between first and second double_crochet at the edge 3 catch fringe yarn with hook and 4 pull fringe through partway making a loop 5 pull ends of fringe and mc-cc pair through the fringe loop 6 pull the ends of the fringe snug 7 trim fringe evenly tip trim to the added fringe pieces if any of your yarn tails are shorter than that they ll blend in to the fluff cloud iridescence by kathryn bernard for firebird yarns firebirdyarns com
